Key Findings

  • The top 5 suppliers to Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council account for £469.9M, which is 27.1% of the total spend.
  • The top 10 suppliers combined have received £639.9M, representing 36.9% of the total spend of £1732.6M.
  • The remaining 6,085 suppliers have been paid a total of £1092.7M, which is 63.1% of the total spend.
  • HMRC is the largest supplier, having received £174.4M, which is 10.1% of the total spend.
  • The total spend analysed is £1732.6M across 492,973 transactions from 2020/21 to 2025/26.

Introduction to Top Suppliers

The top suppliers to Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council have been revealed, with HMRC receiving the largest amount at £174.4M. This represents 10.1% of the total spend of £1732.6M. The second largest supplier is REDACTED, which has received £127.4M, accounting for 7.4% of the total spend.

The top 5 suppliers, which also include DD PAYMENT SUPPLIERS MAIN ACCOUNT, TEACHERS PENSIONS, and HOMECARE FOR YOU, have received a combined total of £469.9M. This amount represents 27.1% of the total spend, highlighting the concentration of spending with a small number of suppliers.

Analysis of Concentration Risk

The concentration of spending with a small number of suppliers poses a risk to the council, as it may limit the ability to negotiate prices and reduce competition. The top 10 suppliers have received £639.9M, which is 36.9% of the total spend, highlighting the dependence on these suppliers.

However, it is also worth noting that the remaining 6,085 suppliers have received £1092.7M, which is 63.1% of the total spend. This suggests that the council is still able to distribute its spending across a wide range of suppliers, reducing the concentration risk.

The council's spending with HMRC and TEACHERS PENSIONS is likely to be mandatory, as these organisations provide essential services. However, the spending with other suppliers, such as HOMECARE FOR YOU and GUARDIAN HOMECARE UK LTD, may be subject to more competitive tendering processes.

Competitive Markets and Contract Dependency

The council's contract dependency on certain suppliers may limit its ability to switch to alternative providers. However, the presence of a competitive market may help to drive down prices and improve services.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council about the council's contract dependency on certain suppliers.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to learn more about the council's spending and contracting processes.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to see the details of current and past contracts.
  • Write to your local councillor about your concerns regarding the concentration of spending with a small number of suppliers.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and learn more about the council's finances.
This article is based on Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council's published spending data covering 2020/21 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
